Typography

Our typography is based off the “Perfect Fourth” scale (1.33) with a base size of 16px. For all headings and body copy, we use a line-height of 1.375em.
PRIMARY TYPEFACE
Proxima Nova
USAGE EXAMPLE

Anyone can invest with us. You only need to be able to invest R500 a month to benefit from our investment expertise. You also need to be disciplined and be able to take a long-term view in order to make the most of our approach to investing. Unit trusts allow you to grow your money, but give you the flexibility to access it at any time.

WEIGHTS USED
  • Thin (100)
  • Light (300)
  • Regular (400)
  • Semibold (600)
  • Bold (700)
  • Extrabold (800)
  • Black (900)
NOTES

Used for all copy with the exception of numbering. Thin weighting is only used for % figures on Fund pages.

COMBINED USAGE EXAMPLE

Allan Gray Orbis Foundation: A decade into the journey

Ten years ago, in July 2005, the Allan Gray Orbis Foundation journey began. On reaching this milestone, Anthony Farr reﬂects on progress so far, acknowledging that the Foundation is still at the foothills of an overall vision that is unusually long-term in nature.

Little document, big ideas

As noted in the first Allan Gray Orbis Foundation update in Quarterly Commentary 2, 2007, the Foundation is the fruition of a vision germinated as far back as 1984 to give a 20% interest in the then partnership of Allan Gray Investment Counsel to the Allan Gray Development Trust to sponsor black entrepreneurs. Around 20 years later the Foundation emerged, directed by a three-page document capturing the proposed intent of the initiative, starting with the clear mission to promote prosperity through entrepreneurship in an integrated South Africa. This little document, which formed the basis of the Foundation's Trust Deed, has guided us remarkably well over the years - especially on the main tasks of selecting and developing entrepreneurial ability.

Configuration options

The heading sizes should be element agnostic. This means, that you can have h1, h2, h3 styling on any element type by using the class combinations below. You should not be limited to having to use the element to get the styling you want.

Class name Effect Remarks
.heading Defines an element to be a heading component Optional. Provides top/bottom margins on the heading.
.heading--display-N Sets the element's font size, color, and weight Optional. Used with the .heading class N is 1-5 inclusive (1 is largest, 5 is smallest.)
